whenToUse.title: in

items.text: I lived in Spain for two years.
The Prado Museum is in Madrid.
We have breakfast in the kitchen.
She works in a shop.
We saw ancient artifacts in a museum.
The children play in a park.
We grow roses in a garden.
He listens to music in a car.
My birthday is in February.
Schools finish in June.
It snows a lot in the winter.
The project will be completed in 2026.
I go for a run in the morning.
Let's meet for coffee in the afternoon.
I like to read in the evening.

explanation: Use in for periods of time (months, years, seasons, times of day), locations within larger areas (countries, cities), and enclosed spaces (rooms, buildings).

whenToUse.title: on

items.text: She goes to work on a bike every day.
I read a book on the bus this morning.
We met some nice people on the train to Barcelona.
You're not allowed to use your phone on a plane during takeoff.
They spent their honeymoon on a ship in the Mediterranean.
The cat is sleeping on the floor.
Please put the keys on the table.
All the books are organized on the shelf.
We have breakfast on the balcony when it's sunny.
There's a beautiful view from on the roof.
There's a large painting on the wall in the living room.
My sister's birthday is on 1st March.
We have a meeting scheduled for Tuesday.
People make resolutions on New Year's Day.
Couples exchange gifts on Valentine's Day.

explanation: Use on for surfaces (tables, walls, floors), for public/individual transport where you can stand or walk (buses, trains, planes, ships), and for specific days and dates.

tips: Use in for non-specific times within a period (e.g., in June, in 2024, in the summer).
